channel.title: What do YOU look for in an RSPS?
channel.description:
Title says it all. 3 things that pull you in, 3 things that instantly repulse you from a server?
I'll start..
I like a friendly community, not too many people, I'd say 50 max. Low XP rates, REAL economy Classic Edgeville home
HATE: Spawn servers, tons of customs, PK servers, ::master/::pure servers.
-Kleber

item.title: What do YOU look for in an RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

WTH. How do you end up paying half a thousand dollars a month for VPS??? .-.

Read full topic

item.title: What do YOU look for in an RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:5, topic:457538”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=560463.msg4091790#msg4091790 date=1346455363]

• Powerful VPS, $20 a month may cut it for 50-100 players, but once you get up there be ready to shell out $100-300 a month.

[/quote]

We pay $575 a month for ours, roughly 120-150 players.

A fair warning to everyone, shit gets pricey.[/quote]
You are having a bloody bad memory leak then mate, might want to work that out soon.

Read full topic
item.source: What do YOU look for in an RSPS?

item.title: What do YOU look for in an RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @Carter2 Carter_
item.description:
@Carter2 wrote:

*Old school, gameframe 317-459 only.
*Professionalism. Simple “Welcome to server.” message will suffice, if it has 4 lines of colour shit then I can tell it’s going to be a messy server.
*Low-medium experience rates between 10x-100x
*Godswords don’t dominate the economy. I actually want a shot at pking without one.
*No dickheads running it.

Read full topic
item.source: What do YOU look for in an RSPS?

item.title: What do YOU look for in an RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

the elve age:

What do YOU look for in an RSPS? Make it like that; you are programming a game that YOU want.

If I follow correctly, you seem to think that I’m trying to find out what I should put in my server. Lol
Not true. It’s another “how to we relate to one another?” question.

Read full topic

item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Lin:

If I see a screenshot even taken in Edgeville I won’t even consider the server. Edgeville is the worst place in the entire game and so overused it makes Lumbridge look like a good starting place.

Draynor is my favorite starting place…

Really? I find it to be the most convenient out of all of them. If I even see a non-Edgeville screenshot, it lowers my join rate by 50%+. Homes that are different are about 99% of the time either leeched or just shitty home places…

@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:4, topic:457538”]What I look for:

[ul][li]Non-abusive staff (staff that won’t start shit with you then ban you)[/li]
[li]Unique content[/li]
[li]Owner isn’t a 12 year old immature fuck[/li]
[li]Cache size under 100MB[/li]
[list][/list][/ul][/quote]
Pretty much this. With the cache if its that big, try putting together a JAGGRAB system. Or, at least have the fricking sprites packed…

item.description:
@enzo42 wrote:

*Low cache size
*No items above 474
*No 500+ maps
*God Wars
*Treasure Trails
*Good economy
*About x50-100 xp rate

item.source: What do YOU look for in an RSPS?

item.title: What do YOU look for in an RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

A number of things.

• Stable Economy.
• Good xp rates, not insanely high, if you offer 10000 xp per hit people will finish your game in a day.
• Dedicated staff members.
• A clean, professional websites. If you can’t pay $7 a month for a website, don’t expect a huge community.
• A steady flow of updates, weekly is the best, I get all my updates into the game Thursday night so everyone can play on Friday and through the weekend.
• Powerful VPS, $20 a month may cut it for 50-100 players, but once you get up there be ready to shell out $100-300 a month.
• An owner that listens to the players, whether it’s about a glitch in game or an idea for the content, listen to your players.

There are more but I can’t think of them all currently.

Read full topic
item.source: What do YOU look for in an RSPS?

item.title: What do YOU look for in an RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:
